fields.name: Version control use
fields.description: The proper use of a version control system is important for reproducible science, as it provides a detailed log of all the activities performed.
fields.high_message: Great! You commit often and in small parts.
fields.medium_message: Medium: Try to commit some changes as soon as you are done with a small change.
fields.low_message: Low: You are only committing and pushing very infrequently.

fields.name: Use of CI
fields.description: Use a build tool like Travis CI or Jenkins, as to ensure that your tests all pass and that all of your dependencies are defined.
fields.high_message: High: You're using a build tool
fields.medium_message: Medium: You're using a build tool, but your builds almost always fail
fields.low_message: Low: You are not using a build tool

fields.name: Dependencies defined
fields.description: Make sure that you have defined all your dependencies of your experiment, so that others can run it as well.
fields.high_message: You are using a build tool and your experiment builds correctly without ImportErrors, great!
fields.low_message: The build tool indicates that some dependencies are missing from your experiment. Please inspect the logs to find out what is going wrong.

fields.name: Testing
fields.description: Ensure stable code by achieving a high code coverage of tests.
fields.high_message: Your test code coverage is higher than 80 percent!
fields.medium_message: Your test code coverage is higher than 50 percent.
fields.low_message: Your test code coverage is quite low, lower than 50 percent.
